description.text: IOA YANG module for Software Management model.
YANG Models for Infinera Open API (IOA) for release R6.0
YANG Models for Infinera Open API (IOA) for release R5.1
YANG Models for Infinera Open API (IOA) for release R5.0
YANG Models for Infinera Open API (IOA) for release R4.1
Information on the Software Load present in the system.

Firmware version included in this software-load.
Versions for the same firmware can be different per equipment-type.
Type of the equipment (card, etc) that will use this firmware.
Downloaded manifest files and associated image files.
Downloaded manifest file and it's information.
The packaged FRU information associated to a particular equipment-type.
Software load information associated to each of the equipment.
List of 3rd party applications available per location.
Third-party-app enabled state. If enabled, app is started(app is enabled also upon system restart). If disabled, app is stopped.
List of 3rd party fw files available to be used to upgrade 3rd party equipment.
fw file is present and is valid (crc matches).
fw file is present but is invalid (crc doesn't match).
Cyclic redundancy check (CRC) of the firmware image, used to validate the file when present.
Versions from where the upgrade is non service affecting (nsa).
List of resources that contain this version.
List of resources that this firmware can be applied apply.
User configurable file-server (e.g SFTP server), to be used by transfer operations (upload/download).
Name of the server, as usable in download/upload commands.

Port used for file transfer; if not provided, default will be used according with selected
protocol.
Represents local storage, including USB storage. Requires initial-path to be provided.

The file transfer protocol that this server supports.
Non-secure protocols (ftp and http) are supported conditionally on configured security policies.
User name credentials for the remote file server.
Password credentials for the remote file server.

The directory in the file server that is used as source/destination.
If empty, means the root directory (/) on the server is the initial path.
Must be an absolute directory (e.g. starting with /).
The list of the databases in the system.
Indicates the state of the database.
Indicates the network element family this database belongs to.
User assigned name for this NE as present in this database.
Serial number of the node controller.
Indicates the database snapshot backup time.
Indicates if database was generated with FIPS mode enabled.
